entry.title: Handling High-Frequency message Integration in SAP CPI with SFTP Append Mode Issues
entry.content:
Introduction

Recently we worked on a high-frequency interface using SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) to process a continuous stream of IDocs from a source system. The requirement was to map these IDocs, and send the mapped content to a target system using SFTP. All messages needed to be appended to a single file, and that file was picked up and processed by a job every 5 minutes at the target side.

At first glance, this looked like a simple scenario, but it turned out to be a tricky problem due to the way SFTP receiver works in high-frequency situations.

Problem Statement

We received a high volume of IDocs per minute, and our CPI iFlow was designed to do the following:

Map incoming IDocs to the target structure.

Use the SFTP Receiver Adapter and append to write to a single file for 5 mins after this  the downstream job process every 5 minutes. However, the target system experienced significant problems with increased load.

1. NULL characters in random lines.

2. Truncation of data.

Final file was corrupted or incomplete and therefore unusable. Final file was looking like below:

We noted the following:

The SFTP Adapter in Append Mode cannot support concurrent writes. When multiple CPI threads attempted to append concurrently:

  • Some I/O calls overlapped.
  • File locks failed.
  • The content was corrupted (e.g. NULL characters, partial lines).

CPI does not guarantee ordered or transactional writes when multiple messages are attempting to access the SFTP channel at the same time.

Solution:

To resolve the issue, we redesigned the solution as 2 separate iFlows utilizing Data Store.

iFlow 1 - Message Processing and Write to Data Store

This iFlow receives Idoc from the SAP system and after doing the map it stores the file to the DataStore.

 

Iflow step details:

  • Set header and Content: This is used to set custom header and properties required for processing and logging.
  • Message Mapping: here Idoc structure is mapped to the required target structure.
  • Write: The transformed structure is then write to the Data Store for the next step. This structure should be in XML format for the next step to read it.

iFlow 2 ‚Äì Aggregation and SFTP File Upload

This iFlow is triggered by a Timer every 5 minutes. It reads all messages stored earlier by the 1st iFlow.

  • We have used Data Store Select to fetch all unprocessed messages in the interval of 5 mins. We have given the number of messages as 500, so that it will pull all the files written by 1st flow on DataStore.

 "Delete on Completion" This check we have selected such that no file will be processed twice after successful processing of the file.

We have given the Number of polled messages as 500, so that it will pick up all the messages that were stored in datastore during last 5 mins. If any data left it will be processed in next poll.

  • When Select step is picking the file up from the data store it combines all the files in the following structure.

In my case the file was looking as below:

We have used a simple groovy to collect all the data between the tag <data> and appended them to create a CSV file

def Message processData(Message message) {
    // Get XML as string
    def body = message.getBody(String)

    // Parse XML using XmlSlurper
    def root = new XmlSlurper().parseText(body)

    // Collect all <data> elements
    def dataLines = root.message.record.data.collect { it.text() }

    // Create CSV string with LF at end
    def csv = dataLines.join("\n") + "\n"

    // Set CSV as new body
    message.setBody(csv)
    return message
}

After the groovy the file looks like as below:

This approach created the file which behaves like Append Mode but in a safe, sequential, and controlled manner.

The resulting content is then sent to the target using the SFTP Receiver Adapter.

In conclusion, this method ensures data integrity, sequential processing, and improved performance by safely simulating append mode of SFTP receiver adapter.
No concurrency issues
No file corruption
Scalable for high-volume scenarios

Thank you.

entry.title: End-to-end monitoring of an integration scenario
entry.content:
In this blog post, we will focus on end-to-end monitoring of an integration scenario leveraging the Integration & Exception Monitoring of SAP Cloud ALM for Operations. Get experience with the monitoring of a prebuilt integration scenario ExternalWorkforce that span across the cloud applications SAP Fieldglass and SAP S/4HANA Cloud. You will be able to monitor the exchanged messages and check alerts for failed messages as well.

Scenario introduction:

For the following end-to-end integration monitoring exercise, one part of the integrated workflow of the SAP S/4HANA Lean Procurement has been chosen. A work order is created in SAP Fieldglass and the purchase requisition is replicated to SAP S/4HANA Cloud leveraging a prebuilt integration package (SAP S/4HANA Integration with SAP Fieldglass) from SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

The relevant integration flows for the integration scenario are as follows:

  • Replicate Purchase Requisition from SAP Fieldglass to SAP S4HANA.
  • Purchase Order Status Replication from SAP S4HANA to SAP Fieldglass.
  • Replicate Purchase Order from SAP Fieldglass to SAP S4HANA.

See also the documentation of the process flow Purchase Order and Invoicing.
Below you see an overview of the integration scenario,

overview of the integration scenario

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Business services are the foundation of the E2E monitoring. They connect all the involved systems and messages. Now first, we need to create business service. In Cloud ALM tenant, on right hand side, we can see Managed Components-> Business Services. By clicking configure option, we can add business services.

add Business Service

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

After adding business service, we can configure this.
Configuration of business services involves the following steps:

  1. Configure services and systems that are part of the business service.
  2. Configure filters for data collection. Filters make sure that only certain messages are considered as part of the business service. Note: You can create business service filters based only on messages. Exceptions are currently not supported in business services.
  3. Set up events.

We have now added services which are need for this business scenario which are SAP Integration Suite, SAP S/4HANA and SAP Fieldglass. Also, Filtering added for all AIF messages. And event details for filter have been activated.

 

Configuration for Business Services                                                 

And now we can also decide path as shown below, and we can proceed by saving all the information.

path for integration scenario

Now Let‚Äôs bring the end-to-end business scenario ExternalWorkforce into the scope.

SAP Cloud ALM tenant for Integration and Exception Monitoring

 

  1. Filter for Business Services.
  2. If you click on Go in the upper right corner for filtering, then you can select the ExternalWorkforce scenario.
  3. Apply the selection.
  4. The card in the overview page should look like below,

Select scope for Monitoring

 

Overview on business scenario topology

The overview page offers a central view that shows the status of integration scenarios and services that are in scope. It provides a first indicator where faulty messages or in case of Cloud Integration deployment exceptions occurred. In this blog post, you will get insights of the used color-coding and the functionalities this page is offering.

Note: Each card in the overview page represents a service or a business scenario. The left-side color reflects the overall status for the selected time. You may identify the scenarios by the boxes of the involved services The screenshot below is taken from a demo tenant and shows an extended view covering a mix of business services and cloud services.

In the screenshots below we are focusing on the card of the business scenario ExternalWorkforce.

card of the business scenario ExternalWorkforce

  1. By clicking the ‚ÄòQuality‚Äô icon, you can check whether the data collection is running successfully for the involved services.
    Within the popup that shows up click on the Cloud Integration service. The status of monitoring messages and integration artifact exceptions is displayed separately from each other.
  2. In case of raised alerts, you would be able to jump directly to the embedded alerting by clicking on the number of alerts in the footer of each card.
  3. Check the status of business service events with the time-calendar-icon
    It shows the events from the Cloud Availability Center. If maintenance, disruption or degradation events raise up for a service it will be displayed here.
  4. By clicking on the Star icon, you can set an entry to your favorite ones and track them more easily also in cases there are not selected to your scope.
  5. By clicking on the information icon (i), you can get an understanding of the color-coding of a service's status.

The color of the left side of each card is the overall status of the integration scenario or the service. It depends on the selected time frame.

Inside of a card you may distinguish:

  • In case of monitoring a single cloud service the status of monitoring messages is separated from monitoring exceptions. Clicking on the red bar you may get directly to the list of faulty messages. Same for the others.
  • In case of monitoring an integration scenario you see the status of each involved service by its color.

 

1. Click on the three dots and select Go to Details.

Go to Details of Business Scenario

2. Oversee the numbers in the topology view of the ExternalWorkforce scenario: 32 messages have been exchanged, 30 exceptions have been detected, and 5 alerts have been raised.

Topology View

 

Watch all SAP Integration Suite messages of an integration scenario

Here you will see all messages exchanged via SAP Integration Suite for the integration scenario ExternalWorkforce in a selected time frame. If you click on the Cloud Integration node MyCPI and to SAP Integration Suite Messages on the right side, then this will drill down to the next level.

Topology View

The SAP Integration Suite messages page shows the exchanged messages

exchange message view

In the header section some stats are displayed and the integration flows that are relevant for the ExternalWorkforce scenario show up:

  • Replicate Purchase Requisition from SAP Fieldglass to SAP S4HANA
  • Purchase Order Status Replication from SAP S4HANA to SAP Fieldglass_ERS
  • Replicate Purchase Order from SAP Fieldglass to SAP S4HANA

Below you see the list of messages transferred in the selected time frame and for each message beyond the message status also the package name, artifact name, and other fields.
Erroneous messages are highlighted in red. As you can see one message sent by the SAP Fieldglass instance has failed, others have completed successfully.

Check failed message alerts

Here you will watch alerts that have been raised for failed messages.
1. If you click on the exclamation mark icon! in the left-side navigation and navigate to the Alerting page, then you can select the Erroneous CPI Messages Detected alert for the Cloud Integration service MyCPI if any.

Alert Inbox

Highlighted you see some information from SAP Integration Suite, mainly in related integration flow of this erroneous message. Also, the SAP Fieldglass tenant has sent an error message and with that raised an alert.

In the alert details page, you see all failed messages grouped together for the integration flow Replicate Purchase Requisition from SAP Fieldglass to SAP S/4HANA. Also, you can perform some actions as showed below,
Note: you might see some different messages or no messages as per your scenario.

actions possible for Alert

 

You've now monitored the integration scenario ExternalWorkforce that is sending messages from SAP Fieldglass to SAP S/4HANA Cloud mediated by the Cloud Integration capability of SAP Integration Suite. You have seen how to detect faulty messages very quickly in the overview page, also in the alerting section of Integration & Exception Monitoring along with your email inbox.

 

More information

Find the complete list of supported products for Health Monitoring and how to set up the application in the SAP Cloud ALM for Operations Expert Portal to get started. This page is continuously updated.

If you want to understand the comparison with other ALM tools please check out the blog post Monitoring tools for Cloud Integration capability of SAP Integration Suite.

entry.title: Re: K√ºndigung Vertrag 306293xxxx
entry.content:
Hi Anita,

After reviewing your S-user account, I have identified the reason you are unable to view any contracts in SAP for Me. While your account is set up as a Super Administrator, it currently lacks the required authorization "Display Order Information in SAP for Me." This specific authorization is necessary for accessing the Contracts Card functionality.  

To access the  Contracts Card, your account must have both of the following authorizations:  

  • Display Order Information in SAP for Me
  • Purchase Licenses

To resolve this, please submit a request for the missing authorization via the Self-service Authorization Request feature. Detailed instructions are available in KBA 2891528 (linked for your convenience).

If you have any questions or need further assistance, please don‚Äôt hesitate to let me know. I will be happy to provide additional support to ensure this is resolved smoothly.  

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: **Subject:** How to keep Invoice Request in "To Be Invoiced" status and switch between Invoice/Credi
entry.content:
**Subject:** How to keep Invoice Request in "To Be Invoiced" status and switch between Invoice/Credit Memo

Hello SAP Community,

I'm working with the ManageCustomerInvoiceRequestIn web service and have two questions:

**Question 1: How to prevent automatic Invoice creation?**

I need to create Invoice Requests that remain in **"To Be Invoiced"** status (not automatically converted to Customer Invoice) so I can manually edit them before creating the invoice.

**What I've tried:**
- `SettlementPriorityCode=2`: Still creates Invoice automatically (we don't use Down Payments)
- `SettlementBlockedIndicator=true`: Creates Invoice Request in "Blocked" status, which cannot be released
- `actionCode="04"`: Still creates Invoice automatically

**Question:** Is there an XML configuration to create an Invoice Request that stays in "To Be Invoiced" status without being blocked?

**Question 2: How to specify Invoice vs Credit Memo?**

What XML element controls whether an Invoice Request creates an Invoice or Credit Memo? I see `ReceivablesPropertyMovementDirectionCode` at item level:
- Code `1` = Decrease (Credit Memo)
- Code `2` = Increase (Invoice)

**Question:** Is this the correct way to specify Invoice vs Credit Memo, or is there a header-level setting?

**Sample XML (with sensitive data removed):**

```xml
<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope" xmlns:glob="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global">
```

entry.title: Building Power BI Analytical Reports using SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Building Power BI Analytical Reports using SAP Datasphere

Introduction:

Building SAP Datasphere

A simple and nice explanation I came across in one presentation.

This is by far one of the best ETL data (Extraction, Transformation, Load) platform how intelligently you can use your data from multiple data sources in my case we used S4HANA on premise, SAP Successfactor, SAP SAC, Murex - SQL , Efront ‚Äì sftp .

 

  • https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE
  • https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/d4f3c5a0bb074d09ae9b42b2b9bd7a08/5db9a099826c467e93ff0994fc...
  • https://developers.sap.com/tutorial-navigator.html?search=sap+datasphere

Configuration: 

A nice diagram explains about the connectivity between SAP SAC and SAP Datasphere

Follow the below link and activate the SAP Datasphere.

https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/

Add all the necessary IP addresses into the whitelist which will be communicating with SAP Datasphere including the IP‚Äôs belongs to backend systems, Cloud connector, Power BI

Add SAP Datasphere in SAP cloud connector

Follow below links to configure the connections in SAP Datasphere

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-sap/connecting-sap-successfactors-and-sap-dataspher....

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-members/connection-between-sap-datasphere-and-sap-s...

Created a separate space and assigned it to the scoped roles and then assigned these scoped roles to system owner and able to see the connections tab

Install data provisioning agent..

Create live connections

Create backend S4 HANA Connections

Above connection error is resolved by adding below details in the connections of backend systems in SAP CC

RFC error is resolved but Model import error still persist, and it is resolved by following the mentioned SAP note 3081998

Establish link between SAP DS and SAP SAC and there are lot of blogs out there which can be referred to.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-sap/extending-sac-planning-acessing-planning-data-w...

https://github.com/SAP-archive/analytics-cloud-apis-oauth-client-sample?tab=readme-ov-file

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-sap/sap-analytics-cloud-apis-getting-started-guide/...

Testing of oauth client configuration through postman follow the below link

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/14cac91febef464dbb1efce20e3f1613/e4914540f5c04fd2b5b8b...

Once a successful link between SAP SAC and SAP DS is completed you are ready to consume the models create in SAP DS into SAP SAC including creation of oauth ID and secret which can be used to create CDI connection between SAP DS to SAP SAC.

Connecting SAP DS with MS SQL

https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/data-warehouse-cloud-bi7-connect-powerbi..html

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/sap-datasphere-integration-with-sql-se...

Installing MSSQL server jdbc drivers

I added below jar files

At SAP DS

useful link related to connectivity from Power BI to DSP

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/datasphere-to-power-bi-via-an-odbc-con...

Install onpremise data gateway for connectivity between Power BI to SAP Datasphere..in my case we installed in SAP CC.

Install latest HANA client

Create System DSN ODBC connection where you already installed the Gateway

There are blogs and material available online how you can get Data source name , Host from SAP DS

As SAP Datasphere is a very expensive product it is advised not to extract complete data from source systems but only those really needed to be transformed and used in building analytical reports either in SAP SAC or Power BI.

Based on my experience SAP SAC is the best product in terms of P&L functionality and dashboards performance not satisfactory. This is mainly due to latency as SAP SAC is hosted in Europe and your S4 HANA (in our it is on premise) the data traverse takes time which really increases the latency which SAP can‚Äôt resolve. Compared to that the Dashboards designed in Power BI perform far better than SAP SAC.

From Next year onwards the license methodology of SAP Datasphere will be changed, and they will be integrating SAP Datasphere, SAP SAC into a single product called ‚Äú SAP BDC ‚Äú ( Business Data Cloud ). Where they will be exposing SAP Datasphere to hyper scaler Azure, Google, AWS through connector.

Conclusion:

Unleashing Data Value: It will be really interesting to see once Datasphere will be embedded into BDC from next year onwards when the combination of Databricks along with SAP Datasphere will revolutionize the way data will be shared with other cloud providers like Azure, Google and AWS.

entry.title: Re: **Subject:** How to keep Invoice Request in "To Be In...
entry.content:
Dear requester:

**Question 1: How to prevent automatic Invoice creation?**

Please check the KBA: 2389023 - How to Influence the Status of an External Invoice Request Created via the Web Service

https://me.sap.com/notes/0002389023

The SettlementPriorityCode influences the creation and release of an invoice from an invoice request.

  • If the code 1 is selected, if the invoice request is consistent an invoice will be created and released immediately.
  • If the code 2 is passed, the system will first check if a down payment request exists before invoicing the invoice request. If a down payment exists, the customer invoice request will be created with the status To Be Invoiced. If it does not the system will directly create an invoice and the External Customer Invoice Request will have the status Processed.
  • If the SettlementPriorityCode is not passed at all the system will create the External Customer Invoice Request with the status To Be Invoiced.

**Question 2: How to specify Invoice vs Credit Memo?**

Please check the KBA 2181036 - When Invoicing External Customer Invoice Request a Customer Invoice is Created Even Though the Total Value is Negative

https://me.sap.com/notes/0002181036

In case, your request payload is modified as per the guidance, but still cannot created the invoice request properly, please create a case to SAP support, including the request payload, and the permission to test.

Thanks,

Adie

SAP Support

entry.title: üöÄ Launch Alert! Become a Data Architecture Powerhouse: Your Foundational Learning Journey
entry.content:
To equip data professionals with the skills to bridge technical expertise and strategic business impact, SAP Data Architecture experts and the SIX learning team are thrilled to announce the launch of the Data Architect Learning Journey (Foundational). This essential first stage of the Becoming a Data Architect curriculum is designed to empower aspiring architects, data professionals, and solution experts to master the core principles, modern paradigms, and critical frameworks that define successful enterprise data architecture.

 

üèóÔ∏è Structure: Building Expertise from the Ground Up

This learning journey is structured methodically, ensuring you build expertise layer by layer, from foundational theory to strategic impact.

The journey begins with Unit 1: Foundational Concepts, where you will anchor your understanding in the essential principles of modeling, metadata management, and architectural alignment. You will master basic terminologies and fundamentals, including Conceptual, Logical, and Physical data models, and understand how data architecture integrates with enterprise frameworks like Zachman and TOGAF.

Next, Unit 2: Modern Paradigms & Integration takes you into the contemporary world of data patterns. You'll explore and compare models like Data Mesh, Data Fabric, Data Lake, and Data Lakehouse, learning how to select the right approach for any scenario. This unit also delves into integration essentials, comparing and contrasting approaches such as ETL and ELT.

Unit 3 focuses on the critical need for Governance, Security & Strategic Impact. As data ecosystems expand, governance becomes the bedrock of trust. You will learn to establish comprehensive data governance frameworks (including stewardship and data lineage) and integrate crucial security and privacy controls to ensure compliance and secure modern use cases like AI/ML.

The journey culminates in Unit 4: Communicating Data Value. A great architect is also a great leader. This final unit strengthens the communication and leadership skills needed to influence change, teaching you how to articulate the limitations of the current ("as-is") data landscape and present a compelling, business-focused narrative for the future ("to-be") architecture, focusing on quality, cost, and scale.

 

üéØWho Should Enroll? Shift from Technical Expert to Strategic Leader

This curriculum is ideal for data professionals at every stage ready to evolve from technical implementers into strategic architectural leaders. This includes Data Engineers and Modelers seeking advancement, Solution and Enterprise Architects aiming to solidify their data design expertise, BI and Analytics Professionals who need architectural context, and IT and Transformation Leaders focused on aligning data systems with business outcomes.

 

‚úÖWhy Start This Journey Now?

Modern organizations demand architects who master both technology and business value. By mastering these principles, you will gain skills that directly translate into competitive advantages: you'll improve data quality and governance, learn how to connect data architecture directly to enterprise goals, and gain the credibility needed to influence strategic decisions. Crucially, this course sets the definitive foundation for the planned SAP Certified Data Architect specialization* launching in 2026!

Visit SAP Learning and enroll in the Becoming an SAP Data Architect ‚Äì Foundational Learning Journey Today! Becoming an SAP Data Architect (Foundational)

entry.title: Re: **Subject:** How to keep Invoice Request in "To Be In...
entry.content: Dear Adie, Thank you for your response and the KBA references. I tested by removing `SettlementPriorityCode` as suggested in KBA 2389023. The Invoice Request was successfully created in "To Be Invoiced" status without creating a Customer Invoice. Also, Credit Memo creation works correctly using `ReceivablesPropertyMovementDirectionCode=1`. However, **the Invoice Request created via web service is read-only in the UI.** I cannot edit any fields including discount percentage. **Background:** We have an open case regarding a known issue where discount percentages are not applied correctly when creating Invoice Requests with Text items (without Product or Service specification) via web service. As a workaround, we were considering creating the Invoice Request via API and then manually adding the discount in the UI before invoice creation. **Question:** Is there a way to create an editable Invoice Request via web service that stays in "To Be Invoiced" status? Or must we use a two-step API approach (create, then update via web service)? Thank you for your assistance. Best regards

entry.title: Re: Joining form task in onboarding is not getting assign...
entry.content:
Hello @muqeet_mster ,
The error pop up might be appearing because the custom object associated with the task might be non-secured. In the permission role under Metadata Framework > Admin Access to non-secured objects should be enabled. 
If this is a secured object, please grant the necessary permission based on the permission category. 
Additionally, Custom Task and Custom Task Definition should be granted under Onboarding or Offboarding Object Permissions. 
Lastly, you need to validate the assignment group for these permissions. If the assignment group (target population) is invalid, you will see such error messages.

entry.title: Re: **Subject:** How to keep Invoice Request in "To Be In...
entry.content: Dear Adie, Thank you for the KBA references. I tested the suggestions, and while I successfully created an Invoice Request in "To Be Invoiced" status by omitting `SettlementPriorityCode`, I discovered the Invoice Request is read-only in the UI. I then attempted a **two-step API approach** (create with actionCode="01", then update with actionCode="02") to add discount percentage after creation. Unfortunately, **this also failed for Text items**. **Test Summary:** **Step 1:** Created Invoice Request with actionCode="01" (no discount) - Result: Invoice Request created successfully in "To Be Invoiced" status - Discount field: Empty **Step 2:** Updated same Invoice Request with actionCode="02", adding discount via PriceComponent TypeCode 7PR6 - Result: Update returned success (no error), but discount still shows 0% in UI **XML snippet for Step 2 (Update):** ```xml <CustomerInvoiceRequest actionCode="02"> <BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentID>INVOICE_REQUEST_ID</BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentID> <Item> <PriceAndTax> <PriceComponent> <TypeCode>7PR1</TypeCode> <Rate> <DecimalValue>200000</DecimalValue> <CurrencyCode>KRW</CurrencyCode> <BaseDecimalValue>1</BaseDecimalValue> <BaseMeasureUnitCode>EA</BaseMeasureUnitCode> </Rate> </PriceComponent> <PriceComponent> <TypeCode>7PR6</TypeCode> <Rate> <DecimalValue>40</DecimalValue> </Rate> </PriceComponent> </PriceAndTax> </Item> </CustomerInvoiceRequest> ``` The discount percentage is silently ignored even in the update operation for Text items (items without Product or Service specification). **Question:** Is there any other approach to successfully apply discount percentages to Text items via web service? Both single-step and two-step approaches have failed. Thank you for your assistance.

entry.title: Re: ONB_ Crossboarding triggering in both ONB1.0 and ONB2...
entry.content:
Hello @DiviaRadhakrishnan ,
Typically, the rule with scenario "Initiate Internal Hire Configuration" is used to triggered candidates via Onboarding 2.0
Along with this, system will evaluate the configuration maintained in Onboarding Integration Setup and Onboarding 1.0 Integration Setup. If both the conditions are in favour to not trigger the crossboarding process for 1.0, yet the candidate is created in onboarding 1.0, I would recommend creating a ticket for this issue.

entry.title: Re: IBP statistical forecasting in specified UOM
entry.content:
Hi Jez,

This is the common practice we are following:

1. we add a new UOM to UOM Master data as " 1BU" (1 Base Unit)

2. we add the conversion factor for each product and  1BU as 1.

This way we you can get the History KF get converted to 1BU in KF calculation through standard UOM conversion technique. Same with your Statistical Forecast KF.

Now you can run the forecast at 1BU level, which has conversion to m2 as well as pieces as 1. 

Hope I answered your question.

Thanks

Rahul Mohnot

entry.title: Re: Crossboarding trigger from EC and Recruitment
entry.content:
Hello @harinich ,
#1
The internal hire might be missing permissions from permission categories such as Employee Views, Employee Central Effective Dated Entities and Employee Data. Kindly add these permissions to any Employee Self Service Role, the page will load with the details as expected. 
#2
Crossboarding candidates initiated from RCM will only appear in the dashboard when the rule associated with EVENT TRANSFER and Initiate Internal Recruit Configuration (scenario) is successfully evaluated to true. If any of the rules are not evaluated to true, crossboarding process will not be created in onboarding.

entry.title: GRC Tuesdays: Early Preview of SAP for Internal Controls, Compliance and Risk Management Conference
entry.content:
After visiting Dublin, Copenhagen, Brussels, and Budapest, we continue our European tour with the SAP for Internal Control, Compliance and Risk Management Conference.

Next year, we‚Äôll be back to the origin of this conference, in Amsterdam. If you were with us in 2018 and 2023, then this will bring back some fond memories!

During the first installation of the conference in Amsterdam in 2018, most of the discussions related to control automation and especially regarding GDPR. But things have definitely changed.

Although automation is still central to this conference, companies have started to break down compliance silos, and the 2026 theme of the conference reflects this broader approach:  Driving Compliance, Managing Risk, Building Trust.

But what hasn‚Äôt changed is the continuous support from partners, the insightful customer sessions and the networking event, which have gotten more compelling every year!

 

New Trends and Topics Discussed

 

The alignment of IT Risk and Cybersecurity with the wider Enterprise Risk and Compliance framework is a process that started some time ago and will still be core to the discussions in Amsterdam, additional trends will also be at the heart of the presentations. Including how to adapt faster and more effortlessly with ever changing regulatory requirements with a delicate balance of intelligent automation and artificial intelligence to achieve compliance.

Additional ‚Äúhot topics‚Äù will include:

 

Business AI

  • Automatically monitor and analyse regulatory changes
  • Detecting unusual patterns or behaviors
  • Automating the auditing process by analysing large volumes of data

 

Enterprise Risk and Compliance

  • Controlling key processes and compliance
  • Monitoring risks and the adequacy of your controls
  • Detecting fraud and investigating suspicious patterns faster

 

Cybersecurity and Data Protection

  • Neutralising cyberattacks before they cause damage
  • Simplifying the analysis of suspicious activities and detecting security gaps
  • Safeguarding the operation of SAP applications

 

Identity and Access Governance

  • Detecting and remediating access risk violations
  • Simplifying access management in complex environments
  • Managing user access in heterogeneous environments

 

RISE with SAP

  • Improving collaboration and mobility
  • Achieving faster time to value
  • Simplifying your transformation journey

 

Is this Conference for Me?

 

Quick hint: if you are reading this blog, then chances are that yes, this conference is 100% for you!

If you already are a user of SAP solutions for Governance, Risk, and Compliance for enterprise risk and compliance, identity and access governance or cybersecurity and data protection, and are looking to learn and do more, then this conference will provide you with an update on new features released but also innovative case studies and partner tips.

If you are new to the world of SAP and want to learn how others are gaining competitive advantage and staying one step ahead, then this conference will help you discover how your team can accurately and continuously monitor risks, identities, cyberthreats, and compliance across your mission-critical systems and processes.

Finally, if you would like to meet your peers to exchange best practices and expand your professional network for future development, then do join us!

 

Free Pre-Conference Webinar

 

If you haven‚Äôt attended a SAP for Internal Controls, Compliance and Risk Management Conference and are still not sure whether this is the right one for you, then have a look at our free pre-conference webinar from October where speakers from SAP, partners, and customers shared updates on the latest innovations and developments in SAP‚Äôs Governance, Risk, and Compliance solutions but also insights into what‚Äôs planned for the in-person event.

You will be able to view the recording here: Webinar - TAC Insights: Business Events & Networking

 

50 Words Summary

 

  • What: only event designed to bring together the ecosystem of SAP users, partners and solution experts to address SAP‚Äôs GRC and cyber security portfolio in a business-centric context
  • Where: Novotel Amsterdam City Hotel
  • When: March 3 - 4, 2026
  • What: have a look at the Agenda page - it will be updated as more sessions are confirmed
  • How: Registration page ‚Äì and additional bonus: there is an Early bird rate running until December 31st 2025!

And if you are interested in learning more about SAP solutions for Governance, Risk, and Compliance, feel free to fill-in the demo request form!

entry.title: An Introduction to FI-CA in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud: Simplifying High-Volume Financial Operations
entry.content:
Rajesh, a payment processing specialist at a leading telecom company, starts his day drowning in spreadsheets and bank files. Millions of transactions wait for manual reconciliation, and every missed match means a frustrated customer and a delayed month-end close.

But what if Rajesh could automate 90% of his work?
With FI-CA in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, his world changes:

  • AI-powered payment matching clears payments overnight.
  • Real-time postings to the Universal Journal eliminate manual entries.
  • Embedded analytics give him instant visibility into cash flow

This blog explores how FI-CA simplifies high-volume financial operations, why it‚Äôs a game-changer for industries like telecom and utilities, and how businesses can leverage cloud agility and automation to stay ahead.


This blog explores how FI-CA simplifies high-volume financial operations, why it‚Äôs a game-changer for industries like telecom and utilities, and how businesses can leverage cloud agility and automation to stay ahead.

What is FI-CA?

Financial Contract Accounting (FI-CA) is SAP‚Äôs specialized subledger designed for industries that handle high-volume, low-value transactions‚Äîsuch as utilities, telecom, insurance, and subscription-based businesses. Unlike traditional FI-AR, FI-CA offers mass processing capabilities, flexible payment handling, and integration with industry-specific solutions like SAP BRIM.

Why FI-CA in Public Cloud?

With businesses moving to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, FI-CA has evolved to deliver:

  • Fit-to-Standard Processes: Preconfigured best practices for faster deployment.
  • Quarterly Innovation Updates: No upgrade projects‚Äîcontinuous delivery of new features.
  • Scalability & Compliance: Built-in support for global accounting standards and tax regulations.
  • Integration with AI & Automation: Smart payment matching, predictive insights, and anomaly detection.

Key Capabilities in Public Cloud

  • Contract Account Management: Manage customer accounts, payment terms, and dunning.
  • Mass Processing: Handle millions of transactions efficiently.
  • Payment Handling: Automated clearing, payment lots, and integration with SAP Cash Application.
  • Event-Based Revenue Recognition: Align revenue with subscription and usage-based billing.
  • Universal Journal Integration: Real-time posting to the General Ledger for transparency.

What‚Äôs New in Public Cloud?

  • AI-Powered Payment Allocation: Reduce manual clarification cases.
  • Embedded Analytics: Real-time dashboards for receivables and collections.
  • Integration with SAP BRIM: End-to-end subscription and usage billing.
  • Standardized Processes: Fit-to-standard approach ensures compliance and reduces complexity.

Benefits for Businesses

  • Lower TCO: No infrastructure overhead, predictable subscription pricing.
  • Faster Time-to-Value: Preconfigured scenarios and SAP Activate methodology.
  • Continuous Innovation: Access to latest features without disruptive upgrades.

Who Should Consider FI-CA in Public Cloud?

  • Utilities & Telecom Providers managing millions of customer transactions.
  • Subscription-Based Businesses looking for flexible billing and revenue recognition.
  • Financial Services aiming for automation in collections and dispute management.

Conclusion

FI-CA in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is not just a migration‚Äîit‚Äôs a transformation. By combining high-volume processing capabilities with cloud agility and AI-driven automation, businesses can streamline operations, improve cash flow, and stay future-ready.

entry.title: Enhancements‚ÄØto‚ÄØCustom CDS Views‚ÄØCreated‚ÄØBased on‚ÄØC-1 Released‚ÄØI_ProjectBillingElement View
entry.content:
This blog is relevant for you if you have‚ÄØcustom CDS views‚ÄØthat‚ÄØare based on the‚ÄØI_ProjectBillingElement‚ÄØ(C-1 released) view.

Introduction

Core Data Services (CDS) is a pivotal technology in the SAP ecosystem, especially within SAP S/4HANA. CDS views are virtual data models that allow you to define and consume semantically rich data models directly on the database. They provide a powerful abstraction layer, enabling developers and business users to access, combine, and analyze data from multiple sources in a consistent and efficient manner. 

CDS views are used extensively for reporting, analytics, and extending standard SAP applications without modifying the underlying codebase. They support advanced features such as associations, annotations, and access control, making them a cornerstone for modern SAP development and extensibility. 

 

The Role of I_ProjectBillingElement 

Within SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the I_ProjectBillingElement CDS view is a released (C-1) interface view that contains details for the project billing elements. Many customers and partners create custom CDS views based on this standard view to tailor reporting and analytics to their specific business needs. 

However, as SAP continues to enhance its standard content for better performance and scalability, changes to these foundational views can sometimes introduce incompatible changes that require immediate attention from customers who have built custom extensions on top of them. In this blog, we will elaborate on incompatible changes to CDS views based on I_ProjectBillingElement and the required action that needs to be taken. 

 

The Incompatible Change ‚Äî Association Replacement in I_ProjectBillingElement 

With the release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602, we have made a significant change to the I_ProjectBillingElement view. The previously used _WBSElement association has been replaced with the _EnterpriseProjectElement association in the I_ProjectBillingElement DCL (Data Control Language). 
 
 
Business Impact 
 
If you do not adapt your custom CDS views by republishing them or by explicitly adding associations using developer extensibility tools, users will get unrestricted access to the data. Data control will not be applied correctly, and the system will ignore authorizations for users by default. Therefore, it is very critical to adapt your CDS views at the earliest. 

 
Why this change? 

The new association improves the performance of CDS views that are created based on I_ProjectBillingElement, ensuring faster data retrieval and better scalability for large datasets. 


Immediate Action Required ‚Äî Impact on Custom CDS Views 

If you have created custom CDS views based on I_ProjectBillingElement, these views are now referencing an updated association. This means that your custom CDS views may not function as expected until they are republished. Republishing ensures that all associations and DCLs are correctly created and exposed, aligning your custom views with the latest SAP enhancements. 

 

Step-by-Step Process ‚Äî How to Republish Your Custom CDS Views 
 
Scenario 1:  
CDS Views Created Using Key User Extensibility 

If you have created custom CDS views using key user extensibility, you must republish the topmost custom CDS view in your extension hierarchy. Here‚Äôs how: 

  1. Log in as Extensibility Specialist. 
    Ensure you have the necessary authorizations to manage and publish custom CDS views. 

  2. Navigate to the Custom CDS Views App in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system. 

  3. Filter for high priority tasks. Use the Task Priority filter to display tasks marked as High or Very High. These indicate CDS views that require immediate attention due to the underlying change.

  4. From the list,‚ÄØselect the topmost custom CDS view created based on‚ÄØ I_ProjectBillingElement‚ÄØand navigate to the detail page of this custom CDS view.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

    For example, if YY1_CDS1 is created based on‚ÄØI_ProjectBillingElement‚ÄØand YY1_CDS2 is created based on YY1_CDS1, then select YY1_CDS2 and perform the further steps.‚ÄØ This ensures that all dependent views are updated in one go.

  5. In the‚ÄØCustom CDS Views‚ÄØdetail page, click‚ÄØTasks. You will see‚ÄØthe tasks that you need‚ÄØto perform.‚ÄØ

  6. Click‚ÄØEdit.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

  7. Click the‚ÄØPublish‚ÄØbutton‚ÄØat‚ÄØthe bottom-right corner of the screen.‚ÄØ
    The custom CDS views‚ÄØwill be republished.‚ÄØ 


Scenario 2:  
CDS Views Created Using Developer Extensibility Tools 

If you have created custom CDS views based on I_ProjectBillingElement in a 3-system landscape using developer extensibility tools, and if the custom views inherit the DCL from I_ProjectBillingElement DCL, then you need to manually add the association and the key for this association in your custom CDS views. This means that you need to explicitly expose _EnterpriseProjectElement‚ÄØassociation in every custom CDS view that inherits the DCL from I_ProjectBillingElement DCL. You also need to add the field ProjectElementUUID to extract data from _EnterpriseProjectElement association. 
 

 

Why Is This Important? 

  • Performance: The new association (_EnterpriseProjectElement) is optimized for better performance, which can significantly improve reporting and analytics speed.
  • Compatibility: Republishing ensures your custom views remain compatible with the latest SAP standard content, preventing potential errors or data inconsistencies.
  • Future-Proofing: Keeping your custom extensions aligned with SAP‚Äôs ongoing enhancements reduces technical debt and simplifies future upgrades. 

 

Conclusion 

Continuous  innovation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition means that standard content, such as CDS views, will evolve for better performance and functionality. While these changes bring significant benefits, they also require customers to stay vigilant and proactive in maintaining their custom extensions. 
 
If you have custom CDS views based on I_ProjectBillingElement, the immediate action required is to republish your topmost custom CDS views or expose the required association and field in your custom CDS views, as described above. This process ensures you benefit from SAP‚Äôs latest performance improvements and maintain a robust, future-ready analytics landscape. 

By following the outlined steps, you can ensure your custom CDS views continue to deliver value without disruption, leveraging the full power of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äôs ever-evolving capabilities.

entry.title: Unable to add discount percentage to Text items via ManageCustomerInvoiceRequestIn web service
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm trying to create Credit Memo Invoice Requests with discount percentages using the ManageCustomerInvoiceRequestIn web service, but the discount is not being applied when using Text items (items without Product or Service specification).

**Business Requirement:**
Create Credit Memo Invoice Requests with discount percentages applied to Text items via web service.

**What I've Tested:**

**Approach 1: Single-step creation (actionCode="01")**
Created Invoice Request with TypeCode 7PR6 for discount in the initial payload.

Result: Invoice Request created successfully, but discount shows 0%

**Approach 2: Two-step API approach**
- Step 1: Created Invoice Request with actionCode="01" (no discount, no SettlementPriorityCode to keep it in "To Be Invoiced" status)
- Step 2: Updated same Invoice Request with actionCode="02", adding discount via PriceComponent

Result: Update returned success (no error), but discount still shows 0% in UI

**Approach 3: Create via API, then manually edit in UI**
- Created Invoice Request via web service (actionCode="01", omitting SettlementPriorityCode)
- Invoice Request successfully created in "To Be Invoiced" status
- Attempted to add discount manually in the UI

Result: All fields including discount are grayed out (read-only) in the UI

**Sample XML (Step 2 - Update with discount):**
```xml
<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope" xmlns:glob="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global">
<soap:Header/>
<soap:Body>
<glob:CustomerInvoiceRequestBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
<CustomerInvoiceRequest actionCode="02">
<BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentID>TEST_ID</BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentID>
<ProposedInvoiceDate>2025-12-01</ProposedInvoiceDate>
<BuyerParty>
<InternalID>CUSTOMER_ID</InternalID>
</BuyerParty>
<SalesUnitParty>
<InternalID>SALES_UNIT_ID</InternalID>
</SalesUnitParty>
<PricingTerms>
<PricingProcedureCode>PPSTD1</PricingProcedureCode>
<CurrencyCode>KRW</CurrencyCode>
</PricingTerms>
<Item>
<BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentItemID>10</BaseBusinessTransactionDocumentItemID>
<ReceivablesPropertyMovementDirectionCode>1</ReceivablesPropertyMovementDirectionCode>
<Description languageCode="EN">Text Item Description</Description>
<Quantity unitCode="EA">1</Quantity>
<QuantityTypeCode>EA</QuantityTypeCode>
<PriceAndTax>
<PriceComponent>
<TypeCode>7PR1</TypeCode>
<Rate>
<DecimalValue>200000</DecimalValue>
<CurrencyCode>KRW</CurrencyCode>
<BaseDecimalValue>1</BaseDecimalValue>
<BaseMeasureUnitCode>EA</BaseMeasureUnitCode>
</Rate>
</PriceComponent>
<PriceComponent>
<TypeCode>7PR6</TypeCode>
<Rate>
<DecimalValue>40</DecimalValue>
</Rate>
</PriceComponent>
</PriceAndTax>
<ProductTaxDetails>
<ProductTaxationCharacteristicsCode listID="KR">310</ProductTaxationCharacteristicsCode>
</ProductTaxDetails>
<AccountingCodingBlockAssignment>
<AccountingCodingBlock>
<AccountingCodingBlockTypeCode>ACC</AccountingCodingBlockTypeCode>
<GeneralLedgerAccountAliasCode>GL_CODE</GeneralLedgerAccountAliasCode>
</AccountingCodingBlock>
</AccountingCodingBlockAssignment>
</Item>
</CustomerInvoiceRequest>
</glob:CustomerInvoiceRequestBundleMaintainRequest_sync>
</soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>
```

**Note:** This issue only occurs with Text items. When using Material or Service items (with Product node specified), discounts apply correctly.

**Questions:**
1. Is there a working method to add discount percentages to Text items via web service (either single-step or two-step)?
2. Is there a way to make Invoice Requests created via web service editable in the UI so discounts can be added manually?
3. Is this a known limitation or bug for Text items?
4. Are there any additional fields or configurations required specifically for Text items?

I have an open support case on this issue, but would appreciate any community insights or workarounds.

Thank you in advance for any assistance.

---

entry.title: Evolving Our Value Accelerators: Announcing Upcoming Procurement Content Updates Q4 2025
entry.content:
Posted by: SAP Signavio Product Management

At SAP Signavio, we are committed to evolving our solutions to provide you with the most powerful and user-friendly tools for continuous business process transformation. A key part of this commitment is enhancing our portfolio of Procurement Value Accelerators.

From Siloed Data to End-to-End Insight

To achieve this, we have been hard at work developing new, state-of-the-art content. Using our existing Ariba-related accelerators as a baseline, we have engineered new dashboards and, most significantly, a unified end-to-end Source-to-Pay (S2P) pipeline.

This change allows you to analyze each stage of your source-to-pay process from sourcing to contracting to procurement within a single integrated pipeline, with all insights brought together in dedicated dashboards.

As we introduce this powerful new content, we have identified an overlap with some of our older Value Accelerators. To reduce complexity for you, we will replace obsolete content.

This step allows us to focus our resources on delivering the best possible experience and ensures you are working with the most relevant and powerful content available.

What‚Äôs Changing for Procurement Value Accelerators?

It follows a breakdown of the upcoming changes.

Packages Being Retired

The following packages will be retired, as their key performance indicators and analyses are now more effectively integrated into our new, more holistic persona-based dashboards.

  • Reduce Finance Costs for Procure to Pay in SAP Ariba
  • Reduce overall Supply Chain Planning Costs for Source Products and Services in SAP Ariba

Packages Being Updated

The following packages will be updated to leverage the new, unified data pipeline.

  • Start Mining for Procure to Pay in SAP Ariba
  • Start Mining for Source Product and Services in SAP Ariba

For both packages, the existing pipeline will be replaced with the newly built end-to-end S2P pipeline: Identify improvement potential for Source to Pay in SAP Ariba

Important: The dashboards within these updated packages will be temporarily retained to ensure a smooth transition. However, they are scheduled to be replaced by fully renovated, persona-based dashboards in a future update. We are actively working on this next wave of content and will share more details as we get closer to the release.

Impact and Your Next Steps

We want to make this transition as smooth as possible. Here‚Äôs what you need to know:

  • What about my existing content? If you have already downloaded any of the affected packages, you can continue to use your local installations without any issues. The deprecation only affects the availability for new downloads from the Value Accelerator Library.
  • How do I handle customizations? We understand that many of you have customized your pipelines and dashboards. You can continue using your customized content in the old assets or migrate your customizations to the new assets. We have created a comprehensive guide to help you with this process.
  • Our Maintenance Commitment: Going forward, our primary maintenance and bug-fix efforts will be focused on the new and updated content available in the Value Accelerator Library. After the replacement  date, maintenance for the removed packages will be discontinued. If a bug is reported in content that is no longer on the library, we will provide a solution for the customer and apply the fix to the corresponding KPIs within the new, actively maintained Value Accelerators.

Timeline

To give you ample time to adapt, we have established a transition path.

  • Now ‚Äì May 31, 2026: Six-month transition period. The older Value Accelerators will remain available for download.
  • June 1, 2026: The replaced Value Accelerators will be removed from the library, and engineering maintenance on them will be discontinued.

We're Here to Help

We are confident these changes will provide a more powerful, streamlined, and insightful experience for analyzing your procurement processes.

For detailed instructions on migrating your custom content, please refer to our help page:

  • SAP Signavio Content Replacement ‚Äì How to Continue Using replaced Business Content

Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us or your SAP Signavio representative.

Thank you for being a valued customer.

 

The SAP Signavio Product Management Team
